0.title: UK to observe 2-min national silence during Queen's state funeral
0.article_body: The UK will observe two-minute national silence during Queen Elizabeth II’s state funeral on Monday, the Buckingham Palace said. Releasing details of the funeral arrangements, the palace said Elizabeth’s coffin will be taken from Westminster Abbey to Wellington Arch on a horse-drawn gun carriage. The funeral will be attended by around 2,000 guests, including people the Queen had honoured.

1.title: NASA's supernova remnant image gives clues about its star’s death
1.article_body: Astronomers studying the remains of a supernova captured using NASA telescopes have found clues about the star's death. The supernova remnant called SNR 0519-69.0 is the debris from an explosion of a white dwarf star, which according to NASA's Chandra Ray Observatory, underwent a thermonuclear explosion after reaching critical mass. It's located in a small galaxy called Large Magellanic Cloud.

2.title: Ex-President of WBBSE Kalyanmoy Ganguly arrested in SSC scam case
2.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Thursday arrested Kalyanmoy Ganguly, former President of West Bengal Board of Secondary Education (WBBSE), in connection with the state SSC recruitment scam case. Ganguly was arrested after being questioned by CBI officials. Earlier in the day, the CBI raided the offices of two software companies in connection with the case.

3.title: Gems, jewellery exports grew by 6.7% in August to ₹26,418 crore
3.article_body: The overall gems and jewellery exports grew by 6.7% in August 2022 to ₹26,418.84 crore as compared to ₹24,749.69 crore in the same period last year, the Gem and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC) said on Thursday. However, the overall gross export of cut and polished diamonds (CPD) declined 0.84% to ₹14,955.8 crore in August.

4.title: BJP paid ₹40-50 cr to each of 8 Goa Cong MLAs: AICC Goa in-charge
4.article_body: After eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP, AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao on Thursday accused the BJP of paying ₹40-50 crore to each legislator. "The national party (BJP) is doing such things everywhere. Where is all this money coming from?" Gundu Rao questioned. "They are misusing the power. They are breaking the elected representatives," Rao said.

5.title: Nigeria’s consumer inflation hit 17-year high in August 2022
5.article_body: The Nigerian National Bureau of Statistics on Thursday said the country's consumer inflation rose to its highest level in 17 years in August 2022. As per official data, inflation rose to 20.5% in August, up from 19.6% in July this year. This is the seventh straight month wherein Nigeria has recorded an increase in its inflation rate.

6.title: Thief dangles from train window for 10 km in Bihar as passengers grab his arms
6.article_body: A man trying to snatch a mobile phone from a train passenger through the window was left hanging outside for 10 km, apologising, as passengers grabbed his arms. The video is from Bihar and the train was reportedly nearing the end of its journey from Begusarai to Khagaria. The passengers let him go when the train was close to Khagaria.

7.title: BJP 'gifts' 5 autos to Kejriwal after his run-in with Guj police
7.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs reached Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence to offer him a 'gift' of 5 autorickshaws after his argument with Gujarat police over being stopped from getting in the three-wheeler. In Gujarat, Kejriwal had an argument with policemen in his security detail about getting into an auto owing to security concerns. Kejriwal was going to the auto driver's home.

8.title: What was gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's 'Plan B' to kill Salman Khan?
8.article_body: Members of the Goldie Brar-Lawrence Bishnoi gang had rented a room in Panvel to recce Salman Khan's farmhouse. The gangsters managed to track down the route and judging by the potholes, they surmised that the actor's car could be travelling at around 25 kmph. Bishnoi's men also befriended the security guards at the farmhouse by pretending to be his fans.

9.title: World number one Alcaraz reacts to Federer's retirement with broken heart emoji
9.article_body: World number one men's tennis player Carlos Alcaraz, who recently stated he'd like to face Roger Federer, reacted to Federer's retirement with a broken heart emoji. He tweeted, "Roger...[broken heart emoji]." In another tweet, he wrote, "Roger has been one of my idols...Thank you for everything you have done for our sport...I still want to play with you!"

10.title: Video shows monkey attending classes with kids at J'khand govt school
10.article_body: A video showing a monkey attending classes and prayer meetings with students at a Jharkhand government school has gone viral on social media. As per reports, the monkey has been attending classes for the past one week. The headmaster said that the monkey reaches the school premises when the school opens at 9:00 am and leaves after the classes end.

11.title: Shell to deploy over 10,000 EV charging points across India by 2030
11.article_body: Energy company Shell has said that it plans to install over 10,000 electric vehicle (EV) charging points across India by 2030 through Shell Recharge Stations. Shell launched its first EV chargers in India for the four-wheeler and two-wheeler segments in Bangalore on Thursday. The company said that the electricity used by Shell Recharge chargers will be 100% green energy.

12.title: Scientists claim to have discovered a rare 'dinosaur mummy' in Canada
12.article_body: Scientists claim they've discovered a rare 'dinosaur mummy' in Canada, said to be one of the most well-preserved dinosaur fossils ever found. The remains of the hadrosaur, a duck-billed, large-bodied, herbivorous dinosaur, included a large portion of its tail and right hind foot. Large parts of its exposed skeleton are covered in fossilised skin, which makes it unique, scientists said.

13.title: Interstate gang of bike thieves busted in Ambala; 3 held, 16 bikes seized
13.article_body: The Haryana Police busted an interstate gang of motorcycle thieves and arrested three accused including a mechanic from Ambala. Sixteen motorcycles were recovered from them, a police spokesperson said on Thursday. During interrogation, one of the accused confessed that he had been working as a motorcycle mechanic and stole them to raise money to pay for drugs, the spokesperson added.

14.title: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had 'Plan B' to kill Salman Khan: Police
14.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had a 'Plan B' to kill actor Salman Khan, the police in Delhi and Punjab have said. Punjab Police revealed that the plan was led by Kapil Pandit, a shooter of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, who was recently arrested. Pandit and his associates had rented a room in Panvel to recce a farmhouse that Salman owned.

15.title: India emerges as SL's top lender in 2022, gives $377 mn loan: Report
15.article_body: According to the Verite Research think-tank, India has emerged as the top lender to Sri Lanka in 2022 as the country faced unprecedented political crisis and economic turmoil. Of the total $968 million in loans which Sri Lanka received in 2022, India reportedly contributed $377 million to the nation. The Asian Development Bank follows India with $360 million in loans.

16.title: India's 1st lithium cell manufacturing plant to be launched in AP
16.article_body: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar will launch the pre-production run of India's first lithium cell manufacturing facility in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati tomorrow. It has been set up by Munoth Industries, PIB reported. The plant's inauguration will be a step in the direction of realising the PM's vision of making India the global hub of electronic manufacturing, Chandrasekhar said.

17.title: Prohibition a complete failure, have asked Nitish Kumar to review: Kishor
17.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Thursday claimed that Bihar's liquor prohibition is a complete failure and said he has asked CM Nitish Kumar to review it. "[Prohibition] existing only on paper because of rampant corruption," Kishor said. Prashant Kishor also confirmed that he met CM Nitish Kumar along with former MP Pavan Varma on Tuesday.

18.title: Centre, Assam govt sign tripartite peace deal with 8 tribal outfits
18.article_body: Centre and Assam government on Thursday signed a tripartite peace deal with eight tribal outfits in presence of Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "Around 1,100 people belonging to Adivasi outfits of Assam are surrendering arms...We want Assam and...northeast [to] be drug-free [and] terrorism-free," Shah said. Centre seeks to end all border disputes in the northeast by 2024, he added.

19.title: All judges are on the same page: CJI Lalit on reports about rift among judges
19.article_body: Refuting the reports about the rift among judges of the Supreme Court regarding the new listing system of cases on Thursday, Chief Justice of India (CJI) UU Lalit said that "all judges are on the same page". "We have taken a new way of listing. What has been reported is not the correct state of affairs," he said.

20.title: Congress to pass key resolution ahead of party Prez election
20.article_body: Congress leader Madhusudan Mistry on Thursday said delegates of Pradesh Congress Committees (PCC) will pass a resolution to authorise the party's next President to appoint state chiefs. Mistry said the procedure to elect the party's next President was "open" and nothing would be hidden. Mistry said over 9,000 PCC delegates were being issued QR code-attached identity cards for the polls.

21.title: Girls, aged 2 & 4, die after family gets 'baba' to treat snake bite in Raj
21.article_body: Two sisters, aged two and four, died in Rajasthan's Dausa after their family took them to a 'baba' (quack) instead of a hospital for getting their snake bites treated. The 'baba' hit the girls' heads with brooms and gave them ritualistic ashes for three hours. After the girls showed no signs of improvement, their family took them to a hospital.

22.title: Google slashes 7 R&D projects, asks employees to find new jobs internally by Jan: Report
22.article_body: Google has slashed seven out of 14 experimental projects at its in-house R&D division called Area 120, TechCrunch reported. This comes amid Google's move to control spending and focus on projects that build on its "deep investment" in AI, a spokesperson stated. Affected employees will reportedly need to find new jobs within Google by January 2023 or lose their jobs.

23.title: Will not step down unless asked by RJD: Bihar Agri Minister
23.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who accused the state Agriculture Department of corruption, on Thursday said that CM Nitish Kumar could sack him but he'll not step down unless asked to do so by his party. The RJD leader stated, "The final decision about the fate of my ministerial berth will be taken by...[RJD leaders] Lalu Prasad Yadav and...Tejashwi Yadav."

24.title: AAP leaders protest after police stop visit to landfill in Delhi
24.article_body: A group of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders on Thursday alleged they were stopped from visiting the Okhla landfill, which is under Municipal Corporation of Delhi. Led by MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj, the group later protested and raised slogans against the BJP. AAP is taking up visits to garbage hills across the city to highlight "failures" of the BJP-controlled municipal body.

25.title: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga meets Defence Minister Rajnath Singh
25.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in Delhi on Thursday. "We had a good discussion on critical issues including Mizoram's strategic importance," Zoramthanga tweeted. In the meeting, Zoramthanga urged Rajnath Singh to provide a plot within the Cantonment board area in the national capital to the [Mizoram] state government, an official statement said.

26.title: Biden administration appointed 130 Indian-Americans: US official
26.article_body: The US administration, led by President Joe Biden, has so far appointed 130 Indian-Americans to key posts, said Raj Panjabi, a senior member of the White House National Security Council. "I'm proud to be part of an administration that is committed to diversity," he said. Panjabi made the comments during an 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsava' event at the US Capitol.

27.title: Institutes have power to prescribe uniforms, hijab issue is different: SC
27.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday said that educational institutes have the power to prescribe uniforms, however, it also noted that the hijab issue is different. A bench comprising Justices Hemant Gupta and Sudhanshu Dhulia has been hearing a batch of petitions challenging the ban on wearing hijab in institutes. The next hearing on the matter will be held on September 19.

28.title: Strict action should be taken: MP CM on rape of nursery student
28.article_body: Calling the sexual assault of a nursery student on the school bus a "faith-shaking" incident, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday called a meeting to give necessary directions on the matter. "Strict action should be taken against the guilty driver, female help, as well as the school management," CM Chouhan said in a tweet.

29.title: Daler Mehndi's sentence in human trafficking case suspended
29.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court suspended Punjabi singer Daler Mehndi's two-year jail term after his conviction in a 2003 human trafficking case. Mehndi's lawyer Arshdeep Singh Cheema said, "His sentence has been suspended, which means that he will be out on bail, pending proceedings before the high court." Earlier, he was convicted by a trial court in 2018.

30.title: Ramdev to announce IPO plans of Patanjali Group tomorrow: Report
30.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev will reportedly announce the IPO plans of five Patanjali Group companies on Friday during a press conference. The companies are expected to be listed on the stock market within the next five years. Other than IPO plans, he'll also unveil five major policies and goals for the next five years towards achieving "Atmanirbhar Bharat (self-reliant India)".

31.title: Adobe to acquire online design startup Figma for $20 billion
31.article_body: Adobe has announced that it'll acquire online design startup Figma for $20 billion in cash and stock. Figma, founded in 2012, creates cloud-based design software that allows teams to collaborate in real time. "Approximately 6 million additional restricted stock units will be granted to Figma's CEO and employees that will vest over four years subsequent to closing," Adobe said.

32.title: India blessed to have talented pool of engineers: PM on Engineer's Day
32.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday conveyed greetings to all engineers of the country on the occasion of Engineer's Day, stating that India is blessed to have a skilled and talented pool of engineers who contribute to nation-building. "Our government is working to enhance [the] infrastructure for studying engineering including building more engineering colleges," he said in a tweet.

33.title: He doesn't have in-depth knowledge: CM Khandu on Rahul Gandhi's China tweet
33.article_body: A day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave 1000 sq km of territory to China without a fight, Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu on Thursday said he doesn't have in-depth knowledge. "Rahul Gandhi doesn't have much knowledge of the northeast, let alone Arunachal. He raises...issues...on which he doesn't have in-depth knowledge," Khandu said.

34.title: Stray dog killed, hanged on door in Kerala after multiple dog bite cases
34.article_body: A stray dog was killed and then publicly hanged in Kerala's Changanassery on Tuesday after the state reported multiple cases of dog bites in the past few days. A wreath was also placed close to the animal's carcass. The carcasses of 10 stray dogs were also discovered on Monday in the state's Kottayam district. Locals had reportedly poisoned the dogs.

35.title: Huge fireball spotted across the sky over Scotland, pics go viral
35.article_body: A giant 'fireball' was spotted on the night of September 14 across Scotland, clips of which were shared on social media. "There's a great deal of speculation...The evidence we have seen so far indicates space junk," tweeted UK Meteor Network. It is likely to have been space junk from Elon Musk's satellite programme, according to astronomers examining it.

36.title: How much prize money has Roger Federer won in his career?
36.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer, who will retire after the Laver Cup next week, has won 103 singles titles in his career. He has won 1,251 out of the 1,526 singles matches he has played so far. The 41-year-old has won a total prize money of $130,594,339 in his career. Federer had turned pro in 1998.

37.title: Google cancels 7 R&D projects, asks employees to find jobs by Jan 2023: Report
37.article_body: Google has cancelled seven out of 14 projects at its in-house research and development (R&D) division, Area 120. Google reportedly told affected employees that they'll need to find a new job within Google by end-January 2023 or they'll be terminated. "We've recently shared that Area 120 will be shifting its focus to projects that build on...AI," a Google spokesperson said.

38.title: TMC stages protest mocking Suvendu's 'Don't touch me, I'm male' remark
38.article_body: TMC on Thursday staged a protest in Kolkata against BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' rally and carried placards mocking BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari's "Don't touch [me]..." remark. 'Modi Ji: Entire India is on sale. Nirmala Tai: All our ideas are going to fail. Suvendu: Don't touch my body, I am male', placards read. Adhikari made the comment while being detained on Tuesday.

39.title: Rahul won't gain politically from 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Athawale
39.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Thursday said Rahul Gandhi will not gain politically from 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as long as PM Modi is the Prime Minister. "The Constitution drafted by Dr BR Ambedkar has united different religions, castes and languages," Athawale said. "PM Narendra Modi is taking this forward with his 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas' vision," he added.

40.title: ‘If a rape happens, is it CM who is doing it?’: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi
40.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Thursday criticised BJP leader Giriraj Singh and asked if the CM is involved in a crime like rape, if such an incident takes place in BJP-led states. His remarks came after Singh blamed Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for the Begusarai firing incident. "On what basis does the BJP question our law-and-order situation?" Tejashwi asked.

41.title: 57-yr-old woman falls off roof while escaping monkey attack in UP, dies
41.article_body: A 57-year-old woman, Munni, was killed after falling off a roof while escaping from a monkey attack in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah, police sources said on Thursday. The woman had gone to the roof of her house to dry clothes when she was attacked by monkeys, they said. The woman was taken to a hospital where she succumbed to her injuries.

42.title: 2 female IT professionals killed in Chennai after being hit by car running at 130 kmph
42.article_body: Two female software professionals were killed after getting hit by a speeding Honda City when they were crossing the road in Chennai's IT corridor on Wednesday night. S Lavanya and R Lakshmi, both 23, worked at HCL State Street Service. The car appeared to have run at a speed of around 130 kmph and the 20-year-old driver has surrendered.

43.title: TRS, BJP not in position to face people due to failed promises: Cong MP
43.article_body: Telangana Congress MP Uttam Kumar Reddy claimed TRS or BJP weren't in a position to face people due to the long list of failed promises. "Whenever any TRS or BJP leader enters your area, ask...about their failure to control rising prices of petrol, diesel and other...commodities," Reddy said. He claimed that Congress would retain the Munugode seat in the bypolls.

44.title: 5 kg gold seized from passenger at Kerala's Kozhikode airport, held
44.article_body: The Customs at Kerala's Calicut International Airport in Kozhikode on Thursday said they seized around 5 kg of gold worth ₹2.5 crore from a passenger who arrived from Dubai. The officials said the accused smuggled gold mixed with other metals, in connivance with two officials of a private airline. The accused and the two airline employees have been arrested.

45.title: Ukraine returned students cannot join Indian varsities: Govt to SC
45.article_body: The Centre told the Supreme Court that the students who returned from Ukraine cannot be accommodated in Indian universities as there was no provision for it in the National Medical Commission Act. The Centre said that allowing this would hamper the standards of medical education in India. Justices Hemant Gupta and Sudhanshu Dhulia will likely hear the case on Friday.

46.title: No stigma attached to word 'anaath' (orphan): Bombay HC
46.article_body: While discussing a public interest litigation (PIL), the Bombay High Court said that there is no stigma attached to the word 'anaath' or orphan and there was no need to change it. The PIL, filed by an NGO, sought that the word 'anaath' be changed to 'swanath'. The court said it was not a case for them to intervene.

47.title: 2 ICU patients die due to power cut in Karnataka hospital
47.article_body: Two patients in the ICU of Vijayanagara Institute of Medical Sciences (VIMS) hospital in Karnataka's Ballari reportedly died due to ventilator failure after a power cut in the hospital. The two patients have been identified as Maula Hussein (35), suffering from kidney-related ailments, and Chettemma (30), a snake-bite victim. VIMS, however, said the deaths were not due to power cuts.

48.title: Malware in 28 games like FIFA & PUBG exploit 3.8 lakh users: Report
48.article_body: FIFA and PUBG are among 28 games that were exploited by malware between July 2021-June 2022, affecting over 3.84 lakh users using nearly 92,000 malicious files, a report by Kaspersky researchers said. Attackers create fraudulent pages mimicking in-game stores' interface to cheat users into entering their social media login credentials. The pages offer users in-game weapons and artefacts for free.

49.title: Will wear slippers only after killers are hanged: Kanhaiya Lal's son
49.article_body: Months after Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal was beheaded, his son said that he has sworn to wear slippers only after his father's killers are hanged. Yash Sahoo, who remains barefoot even at his workplace, has demanded the arrest of "terrorists Riyaz and Gaus Mohammad". Lal was killed for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

50.title: Roger Federer announces his retirement from tennis
50.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer on Thursday announced his retirement from professional tennis aged 41. He stated the Laver Cup that will take place in London next week will be his last ATP event. "This is a bittersweet decision...because I'll miss everything the tour has given me," Federer said. Federer last played a competitive match at Wimbledon last year.

51.title: Govt to introduce subsidy to set up EV charging infrastructure: Power Secy
51.article_body: Power Secretary Alok Kumar has said the government is working to introduce a subsidy for companies that'll set up electric vehicle charging hubs across India. He said a subsidy of around ₹4-5 lakh will be provided to set up a 200-KW charging infrastructure for EVs. He added the government is working to amend the FAME II policy for the same.

52.title: TMC govt 'fascist', 'dictatorial': BJP amid West Bengal rally violence
52.article_body: The BJP on Thursday criticised the West Bengal government over violence during its protest in Kolkata, saying that TMC is working with a "fascist" and "dictatorial" mindset. WB CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged that BJP had brought in goons for the rally and said the police could have opened fire on BJP protesters, but her government exercised restraint.

53.title: Stop embarrassing India: BJP spokesman to AAP amid BMW row
53.article_body: After German car brand BMW refuted Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's claim that it's planning to set up a manufacturing unit in Punjab, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla tweeted, "Kattar Liars! AAP - AUR ADHIK PROPAGANDA." He added, "Mann [and Arvind] Kejriwal…BMW manufacturing unit aapke bas ki nahi hai (it's beyond your capacity) #StopEmbarrasingIndia." Mann and Kejriwal are Aam Aadmi Party leaders.

54.title: Byju's left with 8 days to pay Blackstone ₹2,000 cr for Aakash deal
54.article_body: Edtech unicorn Byju's has eight days left to clear the remaining balance of nearly ₹2,000 crore to Blackstone as part of its Aakash acquisition deal, according to its financial report. Byju's has deferred the payment multiple times over the last few months. It will have to seek extension from the RBI if it doesn't complete the payment by September 23.

55.title: Burglar who stole only on Sundays arrested in Chennai after 2 years
55.article_body: A burglar who stole only on Sundays for the past two years because he worked in an office near Chennai on other days has been arrested, police said. The accused, M Sivachandiran, was caught near Poonamallee by authorities earlier this week after they surveilled CCTV footage. At least 10 sovereigns of gold jewellery were recovered from him, police said.

56.title: Belgian tourist looted by auto driver, 2 others during Taj Mahal tour
56.article_body: An auto driver, along with two of his aides, reportedly looted a 25-year-old Belgian tourist in Agra. According to police, the accused looted 8,000 Euros in cash, one laptop, one camera, a mobile phone and a pair of shoes from the tourist who came to see the Taj Mahal. The tourist, Sevi, a native of Goa, is working in Belgium.

57.title: UP man complains about potholes as rickshaw overturns behind him, video surfaces
57.article_body: An e-rickshaw full of passengers recently overturned in a potholed-filled stretch of UP's Ballia, as a local was describing to a reporter the plight of residents because of the poor condition of roads. He said that e-rickshaws struggle to cross the area on a regular basis, adding that commuters have suffered injuries because of potholes.

58.title: Accused in UP rape-murder of Dalit sisters shot in leg during encounter, video surfaces
58.article_body: One of the accused in the rape-murder of two teenage sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri was arrested on Thursday after an encounter, in which police shot him in his leg. A video shows police bringing the injured man out of a field. A total of six men were arrested after bodies of the sisters were found hanging from a tree.

59.title: 3 empty gun cartridges found at RSS shakha venue in Ludhiana
59.article_body: An FIR has been registered after three empty cartridges of a 32 bore weapon were found on Wednesday from Shaheedi Park in Ludhiana, an RSS shakha venue, police said. Some miscreants indulged in hooliganism on Tuesday night and one of them may have opened fire, according to police. The cartridges were recovered by RSS volunteers who were cleaning the premises.

60.title: 2 women tell Thane man his house has evil spirits; cheat him of ₹15 lakh
60.article_body: A 79-year-old man in Thane was cheated of ₹15.87 lakh after he was told by two women that evil spirits had invaded his house. The women made the senior citizen, who was living alone, give them the money between July and September by suggesting certain rituals, police said. The man approached the police and a case was registered on Tuesday.

61.title: GST collection may cross ₹1.5 lakh crore from Oct: Revenue Secy
61.article_body: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) collection may top the ₹1.5-lakh-crore-mark from October, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said on Wednesday. "The revenue that we'll collect in October...I'm sure from that month onwards the CBIC on a regular basis shall deliver ₹1.5 trillion revenue for the government," Bajaj said. The government collected ₹1.43 lakh crore in revenue from GST in August.

62.title: 6 roads worth ₹1.12 crore to be laid in Hyderabad
62.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal inaugurated the project to lay six roads worth ₹1.12 crore in Hyderabad's Khairatabad. Speaking at the inauguration, the Mayor said that quality of the works being executed must be maintained. Additionally, the GHMC will also install 94 Pelican signals at key locations with push-button option for pedestrians to cross safely.

63.title: Gurugram resident arrested after man loses ₹1.4 lakh to crypto scam
63.article_body: A hearing and speech impaired man was arrested in Gurugram on Wednesday for cheating people in a cryptocurrency scam. Sanjeev Singh used to divert the cheated money to a US-based woman named Diana, police said. The arrest was made following the complaint of a man who allegedly lost ₹1.4 lakh after Diana lured him to invest in cryptocurrency.

64.title: MP serial killer who murdered 4 guards kept in isolation as inmates fear him
64.article_body: An 18-year-old serial killer, who has been accused of killing 4 security guards, has been kept in isolation in MP's Sagar central jail as other inmates fear him, an official said on Thursday. When he takes a bath, jail wardens remain nearby and his plate is taken back immediately after he finishes eating, said Jail Superintendent Rakesh Bhangre.

65.title: Fire breaks out in Cooper hospital's godown in Mumbai
65.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in the godown of Mumbai's Dr R N Cooper Hospital on Thursday evening. As reported by ANI, the fire department confirmed no casualties were reported in the incident. The fire was brought under control, the fire department added. Cooper hospital is a government hospital located in Juhu.

66.title: Goa to organise 'Clean Coast, Safe Sea' program on Sept 17
66.article_body: The Goa government will organise a beach cleanliness drive on September 17, officials said on Thursday. The program titled 'Clean Coast, Safe Sea' will start at 8 am on International Coastal Cleanup Day. "Goa, being a tourist state famous for Sun, Sand and Sea, it's important to keep the beaches clean and safe for the tourists," CM Sawant tweeted.

67.title: Nurses at BMC-run Kasturba Hospital protest, demand 8 weekly-offs a month
67.article_body: Nurses at BMC-run Kasturba Gandhi Hospital in Mumbai held a protest on Thursday, demanding eight weekly-offs every month. "There's too much workload where nurses work round the clock," Pradeep Govind Narkar, Assistant General Secretary of Municipal Labour Union, said. This comes days after hospitals like Lokmanya Tilak Municipal General Hospital and KEM Hospital saw protests with similar demands.

68.title: 2 women pull hair, slap each other during fight at toll plaza in Maharashtra, video viral
68.article_body: A video has gone viral showing two women pulling each other's hair and slapping each other after a fight broke between them at a toll plaza in Maharashtra. One of the women was an employee at the toll plaza. In the video, other employees can be seen trying to stop the fight. The exact reason behind the fight isn't known.

69.title: KCR to inaugurate Adivasi Bhavan, Banjara bhavan in Hyd on Sept 17
69.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao will inaugurate Komaram Bheem Adivasi Bhavan and Sevalal Banjara building on September 17 in Hyderabad. The Sevalal Banjara building and Adivasi Bhavan were built at the cost of ₹24.43 crore and ₹24.68 crore respectively. Officials said the state government is implementing numerous welfare and development schemes to ensure comprehensive development of tribals.

70.title: 8 held for using Bluetooth earbuds to ‘cheat’ in railway exam in Noida
70.article_body: Police have arrested eight men for allegedly cheating in a railway recruitment examination using electronic devices, including wireless Bluetooth earphones, in Noida. The accused were arrested from an examination facility in Noida's Sector 62 during RRC Level-1 examination held on Tuesday. Police are "tracing call detail records to identify the person who was feeding the answers to the accused".

71.title: Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 announced
71.article_body: Pakistan on Thursday announced their 15-man squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Fast bowler Shaheen Afridi, who is currently recovering from an injury, has been included in the squad. The squad also features Shan Masood, who's yet to feature in a T20I, while Haider Ali was recalled to the side after last featuring in December 2021.

72.title: Road in Ahmedabad caves in, civic body's truck falls into the crack
72.article_body: A road in Ahmedabad's Juhapura caved in on Wednesday afternoon and led to Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's (AMC) garbage truck falling into the crack. The area was barricaded after the truck was pulled out using a crane. This was the 92nd cave-in to have been reported in Ahmedabad after July 10. Of the 92 cave-ins, AMC claims to have repaired 84.

73.title: K'taka signed MoUs worth ₹1.3 lakh crore in renewable energy: CM
73.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Thursday his state has inked memoranda of understanding worth ₹1.3 lakh crore in the renewable energy sector. "We are doing extensive work in...renewable energy. We will soon start producing hydrogen fuel," he said. The state wants to install renewable energy projects near the coast and industries along the Mumbai-Chennai corridor, he said.

74.title: Hindu Sena demands renaming of Delhi's Babar Road to Bhagwan Valmiki Marg
74.article_body: The Hindu Sena on Wednesday wrote to New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) demanding the renaming of Babar Road in the Bengali market to Bhagwan Valmiki Marg. The organisation said the road's name reminds people of atrocities done by Mughal ruler Babar on Hindus. "Everyone knows that Babar was an invader, an infiltrator, a jihadi terrorist," the Hindu Sena's letter stated.

75.title: Haryana CM pays ₹2,500 to woman whose pension stopped midway
75.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has given ₹2,500 from his own pocket to an elderly woman who complained that her pension was stopped after records allegedly showed her as dead, officials said. Khattar directed officials to restore the pension of all eligible beneficiaries whose pension was stopped due to improper data verification. He was addressing Jan Samvad grievance redressal programme.

76.title: ₹110-crore misappropriated in Bengaluru bank: State Co-op Minister
76.article_body: An audit of Bengaluru-based Shushruti Souharda Sahakara Bank Niyamita has revealed ₹110 crore misappropriation from its deposits, State Minister of Co-Operation ST Somashekar said at the Legislative Council. “However, in its reply, the department said that the bank cannot be listed as bankrupt,” Somashekar said. At the time of audit, the bank had recorded ₹180.77 crore in received deposits.

77.title: Odisha woman shot dead while trying to save husband from giving 'hafta'
77.article_body: A 45-year-old woman in Odisha's Nuapada was allegedly shot dead on Wednesday night while trying to save her husband from an armed youth asking for 'hafta' (extortion money). The inebriated youth threatened to kill the man if he failed to pay ₹10,000 as 'hafta'. A fire tender took the woman to the hospital as no ambulances were available.

78.title: BJP 'gifts' 5 autos to Kejriwal after Guj police stop him from riding in an auto
78.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs on Thursday reached CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence to "gift" him five autorickshaws, days after he had an argument with Gujarat Police after they tried to stop him from travelling in an auto. Kejriwal has a convoy of 27 vehicles and 200 security personnel, but he enacted drama by travelling in an auto, said BJP's Ramvir Singh Bidhuri.

79.title: Mental strength as important as physical fitness in MMA: Ritu Phogat
79.article_body: Ahead of her fight at One Championship's Singapore event later this month, wrestler-turned-Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) fighter Ritu Phogat has said that being mentally strong is more important than being physically strong during matches. Talking about her last fight, which she lost, Ritu said, "The loss didn't affect me mentally...Winning and losing is a part and parcel of the game."

80.title: 38-year-old history-sheeter stabbed to death in Hyderabad
80.article_body: A group of people stabbed a 38-year-old history-sheeter to death in Hyderabad's Bahadurpura. The victim, identified as Babu Khan, was going on the road when he was stopped and attacked by a group of people with sharp weapons. Suspecting "old enmity", the police said that the victim's rivals might be involved in his murder.

81.title: B'luru municipality using 1984 map for its anti-encroachment drive
81.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is using a map from 1984 to carry out its anti-encroachment drive, after heavy rains last week exposed the deficiencies in the city's drainage system. So far, the BBMP has demolished encroachments in Shantiniketan Layout, Munnekolalu and Challaghatta. BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath has said all identified encroachments will be taken down.

82.title: Richa-Ali to host pre-wedding events in Delhi Gymkhana Club: Report
82.article_body: Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal will reportedly host their pre-wedding festivities in Delhi Gymkhana Club. As per reports, their pre-wedding functions will start from September 30. The actors are said to be wrapping up their respective projects by the end of next week. While Richa is working on Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi', Ali will be seen in 'Mirzapur 3'.

83.title: Nadal's Aus Open final match gave me extra motivation: Iga Swiatek
83.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek, who won the French Open and the US Open this season, has said Rafael Nadal's win at the 2022 Australian Open final against Daniil Medvedev gave her "extra motivation" and "inspired" her. In the match, Nadal was two sets down before he came back and defeated Medvedev to win his 21st Grand Slam singles title.

84.title: Harshest action to be taken against criminals: UP Dy CM on Lakhimpur incident
84.article_body: Following the Lakhimpur Kheri incident, where two minor Dalit sisters were allegedly raped and murdered, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said this incident is sad and unfortunate. "Harshest action to be taken against all criminals. I'd expect the Opposition, whether Akhilesh Yadav, Priyanka Gandhi or Mayawati, that instead of politicising...console the family," Maurya added.

85.title: Connaught Place, Saket to soon get microbreweries, excise dept gives nod
85.article_body: Delhi's Connaught Place and Saket will soon get microbreweries serving draught beer after the excise department issued their licenses. According to officials, 10 microbreweries will be opened in Saket under the L-11 licence while CP will also get new microbreweries. Delhi people will get fresh beers from the first week of October, officials said.

86.title: PM should apologise for doing a fake sting if I'm not arrested by Mon: Sisodia
86.article_body: After BJP released a new sting video in connection with the Delhi liquor scam, AAP leader and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia challenged the CBI to arrest him by Monday. "If the allegations are correct, they should arrest me by Monday. If not, the PM should apologise to me for this fake sting by Monday," Sisodia said in a tweet.

87.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
87.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh till September 17. Very heavy rainfall is also very likely over Goa and Maharashtra till tomorrow. Further, heavy rainfall is expected over Odisha on September 18 and 19.

88.title: Samsung to invest over $5 bn with aim of net zero emissions by 2050
88.article_body: Samsung Electronics will invest over $5.02 billion (7 trillion won) by 2030 towards environmental initiatives with an aim to make the company carbon neutral by 2050. It also plans to bolster the recycling of resources such as lithium and plastic. The chip and mobile maker said it joined a group of global corporations committed to 100% renewable energy called RE100.

89.title: Edtech firm upGrad acquires Centum Learning in share-swap deal
89.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad has acquired New Delhi-based corporate training solutions startup Centum Learning in a share-swap deal. After the transaction is completed, Bharti Enterprises, which owns Centum Learning, and its affiliates will join upGrad's cap table. Centum will continue to operate independently under Managing Director and CEO, Sanjay Bahl, the company said in a statement.

90.title: Billionaire Venture signs MoU with DBS Bank to fund startups
90.article_body: Billionaire Venture Incubation has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with DBS Bank to facilitate equity investments in startups. The joint venture will earmark about $200 million to invest in over 150 startups across Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra and Karnataka, initially. The joint venture will be focusing on 16 verticals and will immediately focus on fintech and edtech, among others.

91.title: Tata-owned Air India aims 30% domestic market share in 5 years
91.article_body: In a bid to have a domestic market share of 30% and strengthen its international operations, Air India has put in place a transformation plan. The Tata-owned airline announced 'Vihaan.AI' with a detailed roadmap for the next five years with focus on growing its network and fleet. The airline is expected to soon induct 30 new wide-body and narrow-body aircraft.

92.title: Guj man mistakenly gets ₹11,677 cr in demat account, invests ₹2 cr in stocks
92.article_body: A bank glitch caused a man in Ahmedabad to receive ₹11,677 crore in his demat account for a few hours. The man said that out of this amount, he invested ₹2 crore in the stock market and booked a profit of ₹5 lakh but that same evening, Kotak Securities withdrew the amount. Kotak Securities is yet to comment on this.

93.title: Some people trying to give it different colour: Tejashwi on Begusarai firing
93.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav while commenting on the Begusarai shooting incident said some people are trying to give it a different colour. "BJP…never does as it says, all they do is divide people and poison society," Yadav added. One person was killed and 11 others were injured in firing by bike-borne men at multiple locations in Begusarai on Tuesday.

94.title: Ready to cooperate: K'taka Congress chief Shivakumar on ED summons
94.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar was on Thursday summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money laundering case. "I'm ready to cooperate but the timing of this summon and the harassment I'm put through, is coming in the way of discharging my constitutional and political duties," Shivakumar tweeted. Notably, the summons come amid Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

95.title: Assam govt asked to pay ₹25,000 to boy assaulted in police station
95.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has ordered the Assam government to pay ₹25,000 to a 13-year-old boy who was beaten using a stick by an Assistant Sub-Inspector inside a police station. The incident happened in Morigaon district about six months ago. The rights body also asked the government to initiate prosecution proceedings against the suspended police officer.

96.title: PVR Limited shares fall 4.4% after reports of a block deal
96.article_body: PVR Limited shares dropped 4.4% to close at ₹1,844.5 on BSE on Thursday after reports of a block deal in which around 4.7 million shares or 7.7% stake changed hands. The shares were reportedly traded at an average price of ₹1,892 apiece. Details of buyers and sellers are not known yet. The stock opened 2.3% lower at ₹1,882 a share.

97.title: Vedanta-Foxconn project going to Guj is attack on Maha's prestige: Shiv Sena
97.article_body: The Shiv Sena said that the semiconductor project of Vedanta-Foxconn going to Gujarat is an attack on Maharashtra's prestige. When BJP's Devendra Fadnavis was CM from 2014-19, the GIFT City project was handed over to Gujarat and current CM Eknath Shinde similarly allowed the semiconductor plant to slip away, Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

98.title: India's Russian oil imports rose to 18% of total crude bought in July
98.article_body: With Russian petroleum crude imports worth $2.88 billion in July, India's oil imports from Russia surged to nearly 18% of its total petroleum crude imports, Commerce Ministry data showed. In June, oil imported from Russia was 16.8% of total petroleum crude imports. Imports of crude oil, products and petroleum surged to $17.7 billion in August, provisional data for trade showed.

99.title: Why was Nora Fatehi summoned by Delhi Police in ₹200-crore money laundering case?
99.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi, who appeared before Delhi Police in a ₹200-crore money laundering case on Thursday, was questioned over her links to conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar and actress Jacqueline Fernandez, officials said. "Both the actresses were introduced to Sukesh by one Pinky Irani. She will be questioned alongside Irani," said an officer. Police clarified that Nora Fatehi is not an accused.

100.title: BPCL divestment plan not on the table as of now: Union Minister Puri
100.article_body: The divestment plan for Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited is not on the table as of now as it can't find an adequate number of bidders for the process, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. The Centre had in August said that it would decide on re-initiating BPCL's strategic sale process based on a review of the situation in due course.

101.title: Pune Zilla Parishad begins leprosy, TB eradication drive
101.article_body: The health department of Pune Zilla Parishad has started a leprosy and tuberculosis eradication drive. During the drive, ASHA workers, male volunteers and health workers will carry out doorstep checks for symptoms and spread awareness. Launched under the National Leprosy Eradication Programme (NLEP), the programme will cover over 5 lakh people in rural and urban areas of the district.

102.title: Culprits should be hanged: Father of Lakhimpur rape, murder victims
102.article_body: The father of the two Dalit sisters who were allegedly raped and murdered in Uttar Pradesh's  Lakhimpur Kheri has stated that the culprits should be hanged. "My daughters were abducted from the house and...were raped and murdered. I demand justice," he added. After the sisters were found hanging from a tree, villagers carried out a march and blocked a road.

103.title: Sudanese woman held at Hyderabad airport, gold worth ₹14 lakh seized
103.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport apprehended a female Sudanese national who was smuggling gold and seized 272.98 grams of gold worth ₹14.15 lakh. The woman passenger arrived from Dubai by flight EK 524 and was trying to smuggle gold in the form of paste by concealing it in her rectum, Hyderabad Customs tweeted.

104.title: CBI searches 6 locations in Delhi, Kolkata in WB SSC scam case
104.article_body: CBI on Thursday conducted searches at six locations in Delhi and Kolkata in connection with the West Bengal School Service Commission (SSC) scam, officials said. The searches were conducted at the premises of a software company. Records were allegedly manipulated in the appointment of teachers following which the role of the company came into the limelight.

105.title: Kohli should be opening in T20 WC, it just gives the right balance: Parthiv
105.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Virat Kohli should open in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "It's very clear. [It] was clear that Virat should be opening in Asia Cup...It just gives the right balance," he stated. "If Rohit and Kohli can play till the first six overs...more often than not they will get India to around fifty," added Parthiv.

106.title: 22-yr-old biker crushed by dumper making an illegal U-turn in Mumbai
106.article_body: A 22-year-old biker from Mumbai, Prafful Sanjay Bhosale, was run over by a dumper supplying material for the Coastal Road project on Tuesday. Police said that the overloaded dumper made an illegal U-turn on Khan Abdul Gaffar Khan road at Worli. "Due to the sudden U-turn, Bhosale directly came under the front wheel of the dumper," a police official said.

107.title: Pak collected $40 million to build a 'mega dam' & spent $63 million on its ads
107.article_body: Touted to be Pakistan's "mega dam" that would prevent flooding issues, it has been revealed that $40 million was raised from the public for Diamer-Bhasha Dam's construction and $63 million was spent on its advertising while the construction remains unfinished. The army gave up a portion of soldiers' salaries to contribute to this project and the cricket team also participated.

108.title: Will feed you in morning and noon, you just study: Stalin tells students
108.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin launched first phase of a state-wide free breakfast programme for students in classes one to five. "We see it as a government duty rather than a cost to the exchequer," he said. "We will feed you in the morning and at noon...You may please study, study, study without any worries," Stalin told students.

109.title: Might even trade Mumbai: Sena on CM Shinde amid ₹1,54,000 cr deal row
109.article_body: The Shiv Sena on Thursday said the mega semiconductor project of Vedanta-Foxconn worth  ₹1,54,000 crore going to Gujarat was an attack on Maharashtra's "prestige". One day, the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government "might even trade Mumbai", said the editorial in the Shiv Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

110.title: Dalit man beaten for drinking water from pot for upper castes in Raj
110.article_body: A Dalit man was allegedly beaten by a group of men for drinking water from a pot meant for upper-caste people kept outside a grocery shop in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer on Tuesday. The victim, who was accompanied by his wife, was struck with iron rods and sticks, said police. Four people have been booked under the SC/ST Act.

111.title: PMC floats tender for construction of 350-bed hospital in Warje
111.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has floated a tender for the construction and management of a 350-bed hospital in Warje on a public-private partnership model. According to officials, the multi-speciality hospital would be constructed at an estimated cost of ₹350 crore. It will have medical technology of international standards and will promote medical tourism as well, officials said.

112.title: 35-yr-old relative killed 8-month pregnant woman in Hyd for revenge: Police
112.article_body: A week after a 32-year-old pregnant woman was allegedly murdered at her home in Hyderabad's Kondapur, police have arrested her relative, a 35-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh. The accused had a grudge against the victim's family for reportedly instigating his wife to complain of domestic violence and dowry harassment to the police a month ago, police said.

113.title: Tiger kills man in MP's Balaghat, villagers told to stay indoors
113.article_body: A 22-year-old man was mauled to death by a tiger in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district on Tuesday. The incident occurred when Phool Singh Madavi had gone to graze his livestock in the forest along with four other villagers. Following the incident, forest department officials requested the people of Pandrapani village to stay indoors and avoid venturing into the forest.

114.title: Ayan, Ranbir visit Somnath Temple days after 'Brahmastra' release
114.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, along with Ayan Mukerji, sought blessings at Somnath Temple on Thursday. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Ayan wrote, "I'd told myself I would come here after 'Brahmastra' releases, and am so happy and energised that we made it here." Earlier, Ranbir was stopped from visiting Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple by Bajrang Dal workers over his remarks on consuming beef.

115.title: No decision yet: Samsung as reports claim it's returning to Russia
115.article_body: Samsung on Thursday said nothing has been decided after media reports claimed that the company was returning to the Russian market, six months after suspending shipments over invasion of Ukraine. Reports had claimed that Samsung could restart sales in Russia in October. It was also reported that Samsung would resume supplies of equipment to retailers and restart its online store.

116.title: Bengaluru Police nab interstate gang that targets lone travellers
116.article_body: The City Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police have caught an inter-state gang that allegedly robbed people of money and valuables at knife-point. The main targets of the gang were lone travellers between states, the police said. Valuables worth ₹50 lakh including 619 mobile phones, two cars, one two-wheeler and one laptop have been seized, the police added.

117.title: BEST warns consumers against fake messages after several trapped
117.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) has warned its consumers not to respond to any fraudulent messages regarding bill payments purportedly on behalf of the undertaking. The authorities directed residents to avoid any message other than from 'BESTSM'. The warning comes after many customers complained that they received fraudulent SMS and many got cheated as well.

118.title: Drunk driver rams car into 66-year-old man in Mumbai's Vasai
118.article_body: A 36-year-old man, who was reportedly driving drunk, rammed into a 66-year-old man on a scooter in Mumbai's Vasai on Tuesday. According to police, the man was flung 10 feet in air and sustained severe injuries to his leg and hand after crashing on road. The accused, who fled the spot, was driving back from an alcohol party, police said.

119.title: Maharashtra CM calls PM Modi over Vedanta-Foxconn facility, says PM promised big projects
119.article_body: Following Vedanta-Foxconn's decision to set up a semiconductor facility in Gujarat, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde called PM Narendra Modi. "I've requested PM Modi that there is a need to give a boost to industries here since there is scope, infrastructure and potential," he said. PM promised that the Centre would help bring "big projects" to Maharashtra, Shinde added.

120.title: Afghanistan announce squad for T20 World Cup 2022, include 10 players aged 23 or under
120.article_body: Afghanistan on Thursday announced their 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Mohammad Nabi will lead the team, while Najibullah Zadran has been named his deputy. The squad includes as many as 10 players who are aged 23 or under. Salim Safi, a 20-year-old fast bowler, has received his maiden international call-up.

121.title: Special plane to bring 8 cheetahs to India from Namibia, pic released
121.article_body: The High Commission of India in Windhoek, Namibia shared the picture of the special plane that will bring eight cheetahs to India from Namibia. "A special bird touches down in the Land of the Brave to carry goodwill ambassadors to the Land of the Tiger," the caption read. The huge plane has face of a tiger painted on its front.

122.title: I told Babar 'If you don't think I'm needed anymore, tell me': Shoaib Malik
122.article_body: Amid debate over Pakistan's middle-order and omission of Shoaib Malik from their Asia Cup squad, an old video of the all-rounder's interview has gone viral. In the interview, Shoaib revealed that Babar had asked him if he wanted to retire. "[I said], 'If you want me to play...I'll'...Babar said, 'I'll let you know which series you'll play'," said Malik.

123.title: Govt panel calls for new regulatory body for classifying online games: Report
123.article_body: A panel of central government officials said in its report that India should create a regulatory body to classify online games as skill or chance-based and to introduce rules to block prohibited formats, Reuters reported. The report further states that India also needs a new law to provide regulatory flexibility to the government. Union IT Ministry will finalise the report.

124.title: G Khan booked for singing 'Peg Mote', 'Choli Ke Peeche' at Ganesh Visarjan event in Punjab
124.article_body: Singer G Khan has been booked for hurting religious sentiments by allegedly singing 'inappropriate' songs at a Ganesh Visarjan event in Punjab's Ludhiana. G Khan sang songs such as 'Peg Mote Mote Whisky Wale' and 'Choli Ke Peeche Kya Hai' at the gathering. The police also booked Honey Bedi, the son of ex-BJP MLA Harish Bedi, who organised the event.

125.title: Dalit sisters' family rejects police's 'friendship' claim in Lakhimpur rape case
125.article_body: The family of the two Dalit minor sisters, who were raped and subsequently murdered in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, rejected the police's claim that the girls were friends with the men who carried out the crime. "Our mother identifies three of the men. But we don't know who the rest are," the victims' brother said. Police have arrested six people.

126.title: Man falls on tracks while boarding moving train in UP, coaches pass over him
126.article_body: A video shows a 28-year-old man lying on railway tracks as a train passes over him in UP's Bhadohi. The incident took place when the man fell on the tracks while boarding the moving train. He reportedly suffered head injury and lost his finger in the incident. Video shows blood on the man's head and hands after he got up.

127.title: Kazakhstan to change name of capital from Nur-sultan back to Astana
127.article_body: Kazakhstan President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has agreed to restore the name of the Kazakhstan capital from Nur-Sultan to Astana. The city was renamed Nur-Sultan three years ago by Tokayev to honour his predecessor Nursultan Nazarbayev after he stepped down in 2019. Tokayev's spokesman, Ruslan Zheliban, said the President agreed to restore the name after an initiative by a group of MPs.

128.title: Exposes govt's claims in matter of women's safety: Mayawati on Lakhimpur incident
128.article_body: Reacting to the alleged rape and murder of two minor Dalit sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said criminals are roaming fearlessly in the state because the priorities of the government are wrong. "This incident strongly exposes the claims of the government in the matter of law and order and women's safety," Mayawati tweeted.

129.title: Pogba's elder brother taken into police custody over extortion of Juve midfielder
129.article_body: French authorities have reportedly taken Mathias Pogba, the elder brother of Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba, into custody over the organised armed extortion of the former Manchester United footballer. Pogba has alleged that an organised gang, involving his brother, had demanded €13-million from him. According to reports, three other people are also in custody in connection with the case.

130.title: Using female police officer to stop me part of bigger ploy: BJP's Suvendu
130.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said using a female police officer to stop him during BJP's march to West Bengal secretariat was part of a "bigger ploy". This comes after a video went viral wherein Adhikari was seen telling the officer, "Do not touch my body. You're female." "Had I retaliated...they would've got a chance to defame...and book me," Adhikari added.

131.title: K'taka man rolls on road to protest against potholes; video emerges
131.article_body: A social worker named Nityananda rolled on a stretch of road to protest against potholes in Karnataka's Udupi on Tuesday. He began his protest by breaking a coconut and offering 'aarti' to potholes of Indrali bridge. A video showed Nityananda, clad in a saffron kurta, rolling on a potholed and muddy road with the sound of drumbeats in the background.

132.title: Work & personal life is separate: Shruti on working with partner Santanu
132.article_body: Shruti Haasan spoke about collaborating with boyfriend and visual artiste Santanu Hazarika for her single 'She is a Hero'. "I don't take his artistry for granted ever. To have him be a part of this project and in the way in which he lent himself is brilliant," she said. Shruti said for them, their "work and personal life is separate".

133.title: Tesla sued in US for deceptive advertising of its Full Self-Driving tech
133.article_body: Tesla was sued in a US court on Wednesday for deceptively advertising its Full Self-Driving and Autopilot technology since 2016 as fully functioning or "just around the corner", despite knowing it didn't work. The plaintiff, Briggs Matsko, said Tesla did this to "generate excitement" about its vehicles. "Tesla...yet to produce anything even remotely approaching a fully self-driving car," he said.

134.title: Delhi govt to organise blood donation camps at over 50 spots on Sep 28
134.article_body: To mark the birth anniversary of revolutionary freedom fighter Bhagat Singh, the Delhi government will organise blood donation camps at over 50 locations in Delhi on September 28, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said on Thursday. Adding that Bhagat Singh has inspired generations of youth, he appealed to youths across the country to donate blood as a tribute to him.

135.title: Fed up of husband's extramarital affair, woman kills self in Pune
135.article_body: A woman died by suicide at her parent's house in Pune after being fed up of her husband's extramarital affair and harassment. Police investigation has found that the victim was harassed, beaten up and starved for many days by her husband and was forced to leave his house. Police have booked her husband, who runs a jewellery shop in Delhi.

136.title: Nora Fatehi appears before Delhi Police for questioning in ₹200-cr money laundering case
136.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi today appeared before the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Delhi Police in connection with the ₹200-crore money laundering case involving jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. This comes a day after the Delhi Police EOW officials summoned actor Jacqueline Fernandez in the same case. Jacqueline was grilled for over 8 hours and was given a list of 100 questions.

137.title: Murderous thug: Amit Malviya on TMC MP's 'police could've fired bullets' remark
137.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Thursday criticised TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee for his "police could've fired bullets instead of using teargas" remark in connection with BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march. "This murderous thug is more than just Mamata Banerjee's nephew," Malviya said. "He holds unconstitutional sway over her government," he added. Abhishek Banerjee had said that police chose to show restraint.

138.title: Truly in awe: Halle on Black girls' reactions to 'The Little Mermaid' teaser
138.article_body: Hollywood actress Halle Bailey is in "awe" about how young Black girls are reacting to the teaser of her film, 'The Little Mermaid'. Re-sharing a compilation video, which features some young girls' reactions to the teaser, Bailey tweeted, "People have been sending these reactions to me all weekend and I'm in truly in awe. This means the world to me."

139.title: Dutch students create 3D-printed EV that captures more carbon than it emits
139.article_body: A team of students at Netherlands' Eindhoven University of Technology has created an electric vehicle (EV) which captures more carbon than it emits. Called ZEM (zero emission mobility), it runs on a lithium-ion battery pack and most of its parts are 3D-printed from recycled plastics. ZEM can capture up to two kg carbon dioxide (CO2) over 20,000 miles of driving.

140.title: Gurugram woman falls out of moving auto while fighting off phone snatcher
140.article_body: A 40-year-old woman sustained serious injuries after falling out of a moving auto-rickshaw while fighting off a biker who tried to snatch her mobile phone, police said. "Gurugram is a very unsafe city. I was lucky no other vehicle was behind the auto, otherwise I would have been crushed," the victim said in a statement.

141.title: Nearly 1 in 5 news videos on TikTok contain misinformation: Report
141.article_body: TikTok search results for prominent news topics like Russia-Ukraine war, COVID-19 and climate change contain misinformation, according to a report by NewsGuard. Researchers found that nearly one of the five news videos automatically suggested by the platform had misinformation. "We don't allow harmful misinformation...and we'll remove it from the platform," TikTok said in response to the report.

142.title: 13-yr-old kidnapped, gang-raped in Hyderabad; 2 arrested
142.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped in Hyderabad's Old City by two persons. As per the victim's mother, the girl went out to buy medicine when the accused forcibly pushed her in the car and later drugged and raped her and left the girl near her house after two days. The two alleged offenders have been detained.

143.title: Don't scream, then you'll say actors have bad manners: Taapsee to reporter in viral video
143.article_body: A video has gone viral showing actress Taapsee Pannu asking a reporter to not scream while asking her questions during media interaction at OTT Play Awards 2022. "Don't scream, then you will say that actors have bad manners," Taapsee was heard saying in the video. Taapsee was then heard asking the reporter to do homework before asking her questions.

144.title: Special status to all backward states if we form govt: Nitish
144.article_body: Special category status will be given to all backward states if the Opposition parties form the government at the Centre, said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday. "There is no reason why it cannot be done," Kumar told journalists at an event in Patna. Notably, Kumar recently met with leaders of several political parties seeking to unite the Opposition.

145.title: B'luru woman, daughter kill selves after family refuse to give away dog
145.article_body: A Bengaluru-based woman and her 13-year-old daughter allegedly died by suicide after her husband and in-laws refused to give their pet dog away for her health concern. Reportedly, the 36-year-old woman had breathing problems and skin allergy and a doctor had advised her to stay away from dogs. Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide against her husband.

146.title: Standing room tickets for India-Pakistan T20 WC 2022 match sold out within minutes: ICC
146.article_body: The standing room tickets for India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match were snapped up within minutes of going on sale, the ICC said. This comes days after the general tickets for the match were sold within five minutes. An official re-sale platform will be launched closer to the event, where fans can exchange tickets at face value, the ICC added.

147.title: Ben van Beurden to step down as Shell CEO after 10 years
147.article_body: Shell CEO Ben van Beurden will step down from his role at the end of 2022 after nearly 10 years. He will be succeeded by Wael Sawan, the firm's head of gas and renewables. Beurden, who joined Shell in 1983, will remain as adviser to the board until June 30, 2023, after which he will leave the company.

148.title: Great try but not a successful one: Erica on 'Brahmastra'
148.article_body: Actress Erica Fernandes recently shared her opinion on 'Brahmastra' and said that while the film is a "great try", it isn't a successful one. She said she wished the makers had put more efforts into training the actors for this kind of filmmaking. "Everyone learns from their mistakes and I hope some good comes out of this too," she added.

149.title: Royal Enfield maker Eicher Motors enters ₹1-trillion m-cap club
149.article_body: Shares of Royal Enfield parent, Eicher Motors Limited, surged by 41% so far this year and the firm became India's fifth auto company to join the ₹1 trillion market capital club. Eicher Motors' stock hit a record high of ₹3,659.45 a share on Thursday and gained nearly 3.31% from its previous close with a market cap of ₹1.01 trillion.

150.title: 5 killed, 12 injured as bus falls into gorge in J&K's Rajouri
150.article_body: As many as five persons were killed and 12 others were injured when the bus they were travelling in fell into a gorge in J&K's Rajouri. The bus was on its way to Jammu from Surankote Poonch. "Deeply pained by the news of another tragic road accident in Rajouri at Deri Ralyote (Manjakote)," Jammu Mayor Chander Mohan Gupta tweeted.

151.title: OnePlus launches OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition in India
151.article_body: OnePlus has announced the OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition in India. The smartphone offers a 3-month Prime membership at no extra cost, celebrating the long-standing partnership with Amazon. The smartphone comes equipped with 80W SUPERVOOC charging, a 6.7-inch 120Hz AMOLED display with a 1080p resolution, HDR10+ support, OxygenOS 12.1 and more.

152.title: Apple website down for some users ahead of iPhone 14 series sale on Sept 16
152.article_body: Apple’s website is down for some users across the world. Several people took to Twitter to share screenshots of the website which either showed a '403 error' or was unable to fully load the images. This comes a day ahead of the sale of its three new iPhones- iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max.

153.title: Bengaluru's tech park admits to encroaching on stormwater drains
153.article_body: Bengaluru's Bagmane World Technology Centre, which includes companies like Accenture, Boeing and DELL, admitted to encroaching on stormwater drains in east Bengaluru. "Yes, we have covered the storm water drain with slabs," Bagmane's general manager said. "We did that only to stop back flow of water from Mahadevapura lake...Main culprit here is Puravankara Purvaridge Villas," the manager added.

154.title: Had some chats with McCullum, he has been, 'stop fearing getting out': Pope
154.article_body: England batter Ollie Pope has said he has enjoyed batting at number three in Tests with coach Brendon McCullum helping him to overcome his fear of losing wicket in the longest format of the game. "I think I was almost putting myself under too much pressure and fear of getting out was probably getting a bit too much," stated Pope.

155.title: 7 arrested for setting police vehicle on fire during Nabanna protest in WB
155.article_body: West Bengal's Kolkata Police on Wednesday night arrested seven people accused of setting a police vehicle on fire on Tuesday during BJP's 'Nabanna Abhiyan' protest. "Those arrested include the one who was carrying the lighter and had started burning the vehicle," police said. Notably, over 112 people have been arrested in connection with the violence during BJP's march.

156.title: 6 Mumbai locals plying on intervening night of Sept 15-16 cancelled
156.article_body: Six Mumbai local trains will remain cancelled for four hours on the intervening night of September 15 and 16 due to maintenance work at Delisle Road Overbridge in Lower Parel, Western Railway (WR) officials informed. "This will lead to Borivali-Churchgate slow local departing from Borivali at 00.30 hrs (midnight) running as extra fast local between Andheri–Bandra–Dadar–Mumbai Central," WR said.

157.title: Russian President Putin's limousine attacked in assassination attempt: Reports
157.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's limousine was attacked in an assassination attempt, according to reports citing information from the General GVR Telegram channel. Putin's limousine was reportedly hit by a "loud bang" on its left front wheel followed by heavy smoke. In 2017, Putin publicly disclosed that he has survived at least five assassination attempts.

158.title: Concrete slab falls off flyover in Mumbai's Bandra, causes panic
158.article_body: A concrete slab fell off a flyover in Mumbai's Bandra area on Wednesday, causing panic among the residents. It was one of the many slabs placed to hold beautification pots on the Mahim connector. Although no one was injured, the residents expressed concern about potential accidents. Following the incident, the authorities decided to remove all such slabs from the flyover.

159.title: What is Ethereum Merge, an energy saving upgrade that has been completed?
159.article_body: Ethereum, the second-largest blockchain network, has completed a massive upgrade that will help the blockchain run efficiently while adding new features. Called the Merge, it represents the Ethereum network's shift to proof-of-stake (PoS), its new system to authenticate transactions by replacing proof-of-work (PoW). Merge will result in a 99.95% reduction in Ethereum's energy consumption.

160.title: Why heinous crimes against women rising in UP?: Priyanka on Lakhimpur incident
160.article_body: Reacting to the alleged rape and murder of two minor Dalit sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked, "Why are heinous crimes against women increasing in UP?" Priyanka tweeted, "The killings of the two sisters in Lakhimpur is heartbreaking…Law and order in the state doesn’t improve by giving false advertisements in newspapers and TV everyday."

161.title: Can't expect women's safety from those facilitating rapists' release: Rahul
161.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday criticised BJP over the kidnapping and murder of two Dalit girls in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri district and described the incident as "very disturbing". "Women's safety cannot be expected from those facilitating the release of rapists," Rahul tweeted while referring to the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case.

162.title: MI Cape Town name Simon Katich as head coach, Hashim Amla as batting coach
162.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Simon Katich has been appointed as the head coach of MI Cape Town for the inaugural season of SA20. Katich will be joined by former South Africa batter Hashim Amla as the team's batting coach and ex-New Zealand cricketer James Pamment as fielding coach. Notably, Pamment is also the fielding coach of IPL franchise MI.

163.title: Nick Cannon welcomes his 9th child while expecting two babies with 2 other women
163.article_body: Actor Nick Cannon has welcomed his ninth child and his first with model LaNisha Cole. In June, Cannon confirmed that he is expecting a child with Abby De La Rosa. Last month, Cannon, who welcomed a baby with model Bre Tiesi in July, took to social media to announce that he is expecting his third child with model Brittany Bell.

164.title: Qatar school shut after 4-yr-old Indian girl dies in bus
164.article_body: A private school in Qatar has been closed after the death of a four-year-old Indian student, Qatar's Education Ministry said. The move comes after an investigation revealed negligence among its workers, "who were subjected to...most severe penalties", it added. Minsa Jacob, who hailed from Kerala, died on her birthday after being left inside her school bus for over four hours.

165.title: Dr Anahita, driver of car that crashed killing Mistry, undergoes pelvic reconstruction
165.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole, who was driving the car that crashed into a divider killing former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and injuring her and her husband, was operated for pelvic reconstruction in Mumbai. Notably, Dr Peter V Giannoudis, Chairman of Academic Department of Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgery at University of Leeds, UK, was flown to Mumbai for his expert advice.

166.title: Woman with toy gun breaks into bank to get her trapped savings in Beirut; pics viral
166.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Lebanon, a woman carrying a toy pistol broke into a Beirut bank, taking $13,000 from her trapped savings. Sali Hafez said she needed the money to fund her sister's cancer treatment. Hafez repeatedly visited the bank to ask for her money and was told she could only receive $200 a month in Lebanese pounds.

167.title: Sonam is going to make for a really fun mom: Swara Bhasker
167.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker said Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja are going "to make great parents". She said Sonam is "going to make for a really fun mom". Adding that she's a "funny person", Swara added she is sure that Sonam will have many stories to tell about her son. Sonam gave birth to a baby boy on August 20.

168.title: 2 terrorists involved in migrant's death killed in encounter in J&K
168.article_body: Two terrorists, involved in the death of a migrant labourer from West Bengal, were killed in encounter with Jammu and Kashmir Police in the Nowgam area of Srinagar on Wednesday night. According to police, the terrorists were affiliated with the outfit Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind (AGuH). An AK rifle, two pistols and other war-like stores were also recovered from the spot.

169.title: BJP takes out all-women bike rally to mark 'Hyderabad Liberation Day'
169.article_body: The BJP Mahila Morcha took out an all-women bike rally from Bhagya Laxmi Temple at Charminar on Thursday on occasion of 'Hyderabad Liberation Day'. Union Minister G Kishan Reddy also participated in the rally. The bike rally will pass through areas like Gulzar House, Madina building, Afzalgunj Library, Ramkoti, King Koti, Narayanguda, Secunderabad, Musheerabad, etc.

170.title: 16-yr-old UP girl fights e-rickshaw driver, others to avoid abduction
170.article_body: A 16-year-old girl fought against three persons - an e-rickshaw driver and two of his friends - to escape a kidnapping attempt by them in UP's Bahraich district on Tuesday. After freeing herself, the teenager reached a local police station and filed a complaint. She said the incident happened when she took an e-rickshaw on her way home from school.

171.title: Repetition of Hathras daughter's murder: Akhilesh on Lakhimpur incident
171.article_body: Reacting to the alleged rape and murder of two minor Dalit sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav tweeted, "After farmers in Lakhimpur, the killing of Dalits is now a repetition of Hathras daughter's murder." The bodies of two Dalit sisters were found hanging from a tree in Lakhimpur on Wednesday.

172.title: Akshay Kumar to support hairstylist Milan's family: Reports
172.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has reportedly reached out to the family of his late hairstylist Milan Jadhav and promised to look after them. Akshay and Milan worked together for over 15 years. Earlier on Instagram, Akshay said Milan "stood out of the crowd" because of his "funky hairstyles".

173.title: Go First still working to restore its hacked Twitter account: Official
173.article_body: Go First is still working to restore its official Twitter account which has been hacked, said an airline official on Thursday. On Wednesday, Go First’s Twitter handle was hacked and the name was changed to 'vitalik.eth' along with the picture of Ethereum Co-founder Vitalik Buterin. Notably, this is the second time this year that the handle has been compromised.

174.title: College student held for stalking, sexually assaulting minor in Gurugram
