348.title: Earth barrelling towards uncharted territory of destruction: WMO report
348.article_body: Citing a report by World Meteorological Organization, UN chief António Guterres said climate change is leading "Earth towards uncharted territory of destruction". Weather, climate, and water-related disasters have increased by a factor of 5 over 50 years, the report stated. Europe's heatwave, Pakistan's floods and China's droughts are the price of humanity's fossil fuel addiction, Guterres said.

349.title: I've hardly slept in the last six months: Byju's CEO on company's troubles
349.article_body: Byju Raveendran, the Co-founder and CEO of India's most valued edtech startup Byju's, told Moneycontrol, "The last six months have been tough, like I've hardly slept." His statement comes after questions were raised over the company's aggressive sales practices, delay in its FY21 annual report and layoffs. "It can't be tougher than this," he added.

350.title: Few passengers injured as smoke emerged from Express flight in Muscat: Air India
350.article_body: Air India said some of the 145 passengers on board its Express flight to Kochi suffered minor bruises during the evacuation process after smoke started coming out of the plane at Muscat International Airport on Wednesday. The airline, however, added that no major injuries were reported. The passengers included four infants.

351.title: Will you fire his also: Assam CM to Congress over Nehru's pic in shorts
351.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday shared an image of former PM Jawaharlal Nehru wearing shorts and captioned it, "Will you fire his also..." This comes after Congress on Monday shared an image of a pair of khaki shorts on fire. Nehru, however, is not wearing the RSS khaki shorts but the uniform of Congress' Seva Dal.

352.title: Fear has returned to Bihar, there's mis-governance: BJP on Begusarai firing
352.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Wednesday criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over firing in Begusarai and said that fear has returned to the state, adding that there's mis-governance. Prasad alleged that everyone, including investors, is unhappy with the state of affairs there. "What has happened to you Nitish Kumar ji in the company of your new friends," Prasad said.

353.title: 7 policemen suspended after mass shooting in Bihar's Begusarai
353.article_body: A day after two gunmen opened fire in Bihar's Begusarai district killing one and injuring 11 people, seven police personnel were suspended for the lapse in duty, an official said. Begusarai SP Yogendra Kumar said five people have been detained since last night and questioning is underway. "Teams [are] raiding neighbouring districts at all suspected spots," Kumar said.

354.title: Indian chips can reduce laptop cost from ₹1 lakh to ₹40,000: Vedanta Chairman
354.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal said that once the glass and semiconductor chip is available in India, a ₹1 lakh laptop can cost ₹40,000 or less. His statement comes after Vedanta announced its new semiconductor plant with Foxconn will be set up in Gujarat. "We'll not be manufacturing laptops, mobile phones...but we'll create a cluster to encourage manufacturers," said Agarwal.

355.title: Was insecure about Jackie Shroff's success in early days: Anil Kapoor
355.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, during his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', revealed he was insecure about Jackie Shroff's success in his initial days. "Until I signed a Yash Chopra film, I felt like an outsider even though I wasn't one," he added. Anil further said that he felt the same way when actors Sanjay Dutt and Sunny Deol were launched.

356.title: Video shows youth sitting on bonnet, others leaning out from car in Gr Noida
356.article_body: A video showing a group of youngsters performing stunts on cars and bikes in Greater Noida in Uttar Pradesh has gone viral on social media. In the video, while one person is seen sitting on the bonnet of the vehicle, the others are seen leaning out from the car. A person riding a bike is also seen removing his t-shirt.

357.title: Mumbai's Kemps Corner Bridge opens for vehicles after brief closure
357.article_body: The Kemps Corner Bridge in South Mumbai was briefly closed for vehicular movement on Wednesday due to a technical issue. "Commuters can take the August Kranti Maidan - [Haji Ali] - Wilson College - Nana Chowk route," Mumbai Traffic Police tweeted shortly after 3:00 pm. Within an hour, police said that the bridge has opened for vehicular movement.

358.title: Piyush Goyal chairs meeting of newly reconstituted Board of Trade
358.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday chaired the first meeting of the newly reconstituted Board of Trade. During the meeting, Goyal stressed on the need to enter into more FTAs with developed nations, urging participants to focus on the possibilities each sector has in FTAs. Twenty-nine new non-official members were invited for the first time in this meeting.

359.title: Not us: BJP after men set police vehicle on fire during Nabanna protest
359.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra accused BJP of resorting to violence during the protest rally at West Bengal Secretariat 'Nabanna' after a few men were seen setting a police vehicle on fire. Denying such allegations, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said that the "police may have done it themselves". TMC's jihadis came and carried out the violence, he added.

360.title: 6 people booked in Hyderabad for illegal water connections
360.article_body: Officials of Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply & Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) have booked six people in the city for illegally obtaining water connections. The accused were illegally obtaining water from the water board pipelines in Bhagat Singh Nagar, Chinthal, a police officer investigating the case said. The case was booked under sections 269 and 430 of the Indian Penal Code.

361.title: Hindi is friend of regional languages, not competitor: Amit Shah
361.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah denounced the disinformation campaign pitting Hindi against other languages and said that Hindi is not a competitor to all regional languages, but rather a "friend". He added that regional languages in the country can prosper only when Hindi prospers, and vice versa. Amit Shah further stressed the need for languages to co-exist.

362.title: Karnataka HC to hear pleas on BBMP delimitation on September 21
362.article_body: The Karnataka High Court will hear petitions on the delimitation of wards of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on September 21. The State Election Commission (SEC) had earlier submitted that the revised electoral list would be released on September 22. The number of wards is proposed to be increased from 198 to 243.

363.title: Google loses challenge against EU antitrust decision, wins fine cut
363.article_body: The General Court agreed with the European Union's anti-trust regulators' claim that Google had abused its dominance and used its Android mobile operating system to impose unlawful restrictions on manufacturers and mobile network operators. However, because of a disagreement on one point, the fine imposed on Google was cut by 5%. It now has to pay a €4.125 billion fine.

364.title: Pune building sold, bought 20 times in a year without owners' knowledge
364.article_body: A four-storeyed residential property in Pune was reportedly bought, sold or mortgaged about 20 times in the last one year without the knowledge of the owners. The building is owned by four women. Police said the fraud involved unidentified women posing as the property's owners. The accused allegedly paid ₹18.72 lakh towards government stamp duties for three different mortgage deeds.

365.title: DHL Supply Chain will invest 500 mn euros in India over 5 years
365.article_body: To expand its warehousing capacity, workforce and sustainability initiatives, logistics provider DHL Supply Chain will invest 500 million euros in India over the next five years. The company will expand by adding 12-million square feet of warehousing capacity in metro cities such as Bangalore, Chennai, Kolkata, Mumbai, NCR and Pune. By 2026, it also plans to double its India workforce.

366.title: Mumbai police officer held for abusing, assaulting female colleague
366.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested an assistant police inspector (API), 49-year-old Deepak Baburao Deshmukh, from Kurar Police Station for allegedly abusing, assaulting and molesting a woman police inspector of the same department. According to the police sources, the accused was in a one-sided love affair with the victim. Despite being transferred to another department, he continued to harass the victim.

367.title: Drug smuggling racket busted in Hyd; 360 kg marijuana seized, 6 held
367.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Wednesday busted an interstate drug smuggling racket, seized 360 kg of marijuana and arrested six persons in connection with the case. Three cars, eight mobile phones and ₹10,000 cash, worth a total of ₹1.2 crore were seized from them, police said. The main accused in the case hails from Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district, police added.

368.title: SC allows BCCI to amend constitution, clears way for extension of Ganguly, Shah's terms
368.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly and Secretary Jay Shah are set to continue for another term after the Supreme Court allowed the BCCI to amend its constitution. The apex court said that an office-bearer need not go into cooling off after one term at the state and BCCI levels. It allowed two consecutive terms each at both levels.

369.title: Had reservations about my role, but couldn't say no: Ileana on 'Barfi'
369.article_body: Celebrating 10 years of 'Barfi', actress Ileana D'Cruz said that even though she had reservations about how her role would turn out, she couldn't say no to the film. She said 'Barfi' had "soul in it" and it was a film that she knew she'd never get again. "It's the one film I genuinely gave my heart to," she added.

370.title: Maha man swept away with bike as he tries crossing flooded bridge
370.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man trying to cross a flooded bridge on his motorbike in Maharashtra's Akola. The man was seen losing control of the vehicle, following which he was swept away by the swollen river along with his bike. A group of people were seen watching the incident. The man was reportedly saved and is alive.

371.title: Man dies days after road accident involving stray dog in Kerala
371.article_body: A 25-year-old man died days after he was injured in a road accident involving a stray dog in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram. The accident occurred after the canine jumped before a vehicle in front of his bike. The victim fell from his bike and sustained injuries on his head. He underwent an emergency surgery at a private hospital but didn't survive.

372.title: Case filed against Ajay Devgn's 'Thank God' for hurting religious sentiments
372.article_body: A case has been filed against filmmaker Indra Kumar's upcoming film, 'Thank God', starring Ajay Devgn and Sidharth Malhotra for hurting religious sentiments. The case was filed by lawyer Himanshu Srivastava in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur court. Devgn plays the role of Chitragupta, a Hindu deity, in the movie which also features Nora Fatehi and Rakul Preet Singh.

373.title: Have become bigger fan of Madhuri after working with her: 'Maja Ma' director
373.article_body: Director Anand Tiwari said he has become a "bigger fan" of Madhuri Dixit after directing her in his upcoming film 'Maja Ma'. "Everything I know about films and storytelling is thanks to artists like her," he wrote. Stating that he has learned a lot from her, Anand said he "can't thank her enough for making this film her own".

374.title: Saker, Hussey join England's coaching staff for 2022 T20 WC
374.article_body: Former Australian cricketers David Saker and Michael Hussey have joined England's coaching staff as consultants for the upcoming T20 World Cup, the ECB has announced. Saker, who was England's bowling coach from 2010 to 2015, will join the Matthew Mott-led English coaching staff for their seven-match T20I series against Pakistan. Hussey will join during the World Cup.

375.title: Google to face most of Texas' lawsuit over ad dominance: Judge
375.article_body: A federal judge ruled that Google will have to face most antitrust allegations about its online advertising dominance brought in a lawsuit by attorneys general for Texas and 16 other states. The Alphabet Inc company, however, won a motion to dismiss an allegation that a cooperation deal it struck with Facebook in 2018 was an unlawful restraint of trade.

376.title: EV charging US-based startup TeraWatt raises $1 bn in Series A round
376.article_body: San Francisco-based electric vehicle charging startup TeraWatt Infrastructure has raised $1 billion in its Series A funding round. Existing investors Keyframe Capital and Cyrus Capital participated and Vision Ridge Partners also joined the latest funding round. TeraWatt plans to use the funds to expand a network of charging centres focused on EV fleet customers, the company said in a statement.

377.title: 1st direct flight from South India to Australia takes off from B'luru today
377.article_body: Australian carrier Qantas is operating its first direct flight from Bengaluru to Sydney on Wednesday, making it the first direct flight from South India to Australia. QF68 will take off from Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport around 6:35 pm and the duration of the flight is around 11 hours. Seats were sold out on day one, reports said.

378.title: Tata Power arm gets ₹596 crore LoA for solar project in MP
378.article_body: Tata Power Solar Systems Limited got a letter of award (LoA) worth ₹596 crore from NHDC Limited for setting up a 125 MW floating solar project in Madhya Pradesh. Bids were invited for the project to be set up at the Omkareshwar reservoir in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa. NHDC is a joint venture of NHPC Limited and Madhya Pradesh government.

379.title: Byju's losses surge nearly 17 times to ₹4,588 crore in FY21, posts 14% revenue drop
379.article_body: Byju's recorded a ₹4,588 crore loss in FY21, nearly 17 times the ₹262 crore loss in FY20, revealed the FY21 results. The company's revenue fell 14% year-on-year to ₹2,428 crore on a consolidated basis, down from ₹2,704 crore the previous year. It said almost 40% of its revenue in FY21 was deferred to subsequent years due to new accounting practices.

380.title: 19-year-old Pune girl found dead, her friend jumps off building as body was being moved
380.article_body: Two 19-year-old childhood friends allegedly died by suicide in Pune within two hours. Sanika Bhagwat was found dead at her home and her friend Akansha Gaikwad reached there when the police was conducting probe. When Bhagwat's body was being taken in the ambulance, Gaikwad went to the terrace of the five-floor building and jumped to her death, police said.

381.title: BJP will have to pay for comments on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Ashok Gehlot
381.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said the Congress party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is getting an overwhelming response from the public. "BJP people are worried and making comments. The more they will comment on the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', the more price they will have to pay," Gehlot added. Congress launched its 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari on September 7.

382.title: WB has turned into a 'lawless, bankrupt' state under Mamata: BJP
382.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Wednesday said that West Bengal has become a "lawless and bankrupt state" under CM Mamata Banerjee's leadership. He was reacting to the violence that erupted during the BJP's protest march to the state secretariat 'Nabanna' on Tuesday. Mamata talks about saving democracy but has crossed all limits of violation of democratic rights, he said.

383.title: 'Operation Lotus' fails in Delhi & Punjab, succeeds in Goa: AAP MP
383.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha on Wednesday said "Operation Lotus" failed in Delhi and Punjab but succeeded in Goa. His statement came as eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP today. "When you vote for Congress, you elect a future BJP MLA. Congress is over, resting in pieces," Chadha tweeted. Meanwhile, Goa CM Pramod Sawant said that the MLAs joined BJP unconditionally.

384.title: PM condoles loss of lives in J&K accident, announces ex-gratia
384.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has condoled the loss of lives after 11 people were killed when a bus they were travelling in met with an accident in J&K's Poonch. He's announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of the deceased and ₹50,000 compensation for those injured. The bus reportedly skidded off the road and plunged into a gorge.

385.title: CBI arrests ex-Andhra YSR Congress Party MP Geetha Kothapalli in PNB cheating case
385.article_body: CBI arrested former YSR Congress Party MP from Andhra Pradesh's Araku seat, Geetha Kothapalli, in connection with a bank cheating case. CBI had filed a charge-sheet in 2015 against Geetha and her husband for allegedly defrauding the Punjab National Bank (PNB) in Hyderabad of up to ₹42 crore. CBI had claimed that the accused provided wrong information to PNB.

386.title: Bezos loses $10 bn in a day, Musk's wealth declines by $8.4 bn amid market selloff
386.article_body: Amid a US stock market selloff, the wealth of America's richest billionaires declined by $93 billion on Tuesday. While the world's richest person Elon Musk's net worth dropped by $8.4 billion, Jeff Bezos' wealth's plummeted by $9.8 billion and the fortunes of Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Page, Sergey Brin and Steve Ballmer all declined by over $4 billion.

387.title: BJP's 'Operation Kichad' fast-tracked in Goa: Jairam as 8 Cong MLAs join BJP
387.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that "Operation Kichad" of the BJP in Goa has been fast-tracked because of the visible success of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. His statement came as eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP. "BJP is nervous. A daily dose of diversion and disinformation is handed out to undermine the yatra," Ramesh tweeted. "We remain undeterred," he added.

388.title: Pune among 7 cities picked for Urban Flood Risk Management project
388.article_body: The Union government has selected Pune along with 6 other cities for its project on Urban Flood Risk Management. According to Additional Municipal Commissioner Ravindra Binawade, the Union government has sanctioned ₹50 crore to implement the programme in Pune. The funds will be allocated for five years till 2025-2026, the central government informed Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) last week.

389.title: UK inflation falls to 9.9% in August as fuel prices decline
389.article_body: UK consumer price inflation fell to 9.9% in August, official figures showed. This was driven by lower fuel prices which dropped by 6.8% in August, registering their largest monthly fall since April 2020. CPI had reached a 40-year high of 10.1% in July, the ONS said. CPI rose by 0.5% from July to August on a non-seasonally adjusted basis.

390.title: Ryan Reynolds undergoes 'potentially life-saving' surgery, records it on camera
390.article_body: Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds had an "extremely subtle polyp" removed in a "potentially life-saving" colonoscopy. The actor underwent the procedure with his friend Rob McElhenney on camera in a new YouTube video to raise awareness on colon cancer. "This was potentially life-saving for you, I'm not kidding, I'm not being overly dramatic," the doctor told Ryan.

391.title: What happened in 1984 was not riots, it was genocide: Diljit Dosanjh
391.article_body: Speaking about the 1984 Sikh riots, actor Diljit Dosanjh said it should be called genocide and not riots. "When there is a two-sided fight between people, then it's a riot. According to me, it should be called genocide," he added. The riots that began after the assassination of former PM Indira Gandhi resulted in the deaths of over 3,000 Sikhs.

392.title: Pakistan's middle order needs to be changed for T20 World Cup: Inzamam
392.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that the middle-order batting is the biggest concern for the Babar Azam-led side in the T20 World Cup. "The middle order needs to be changed. Australia will be a different ball game," stated Inzamam. "I think Shan Masood and Sharjeel (Khan) and Shoaib Malik should be in the team," he added.

393.title: Man’s nose, ear chopped off for getting daughter remarried in Rajasthan
393.article_body: The nose and ear of a 55-year-old man were chopped off by over a dozen people at a village in Rajasthan's Barmer on Tuesday night for getting his daughter remarried after separation from her husband. According to police, the attackers are believed to be her ex-husband's relatives. They took away his nose and ear with them, his family said.

394.title: Noida man kills wife by hitting her with 'tawa' over delay in dinner
394.article_body: A Noida-based man allegedly murdered his wife after she delayed serving dinner to him. The accused Anuj Kumar, an autorickshaw driver by profession, hit his wife in the head with 'tawa' (pan) leading to her death, the police said. Police informed that the incident took place at Shramik Kunj at Mamura in Sector 66.

395.title: Goodyear settles labour abuse claims with Malaysian factory workers: Report
395.article_body: Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company has reached an agreement to settle a labour dispute at its Malaysian factory with migrant workers who alleged unpaid wages and benefits, Reuters reported. Factory workers reportedly said the settlement agreements signed this year ranged from about $11,000 to $44,200 per worker. The total settlement amount exceeded the original claim of around five million ringgit.

396.title: Asked SRK many questions everyday during 'Brahmastra' shoot: Mouni
396.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy recalled working with actor Shah Rukh Khan in 'Brahmastra' and said that she was "completely amazed" by him. "I used to have so many questions every single day and I would just go and ask him. He was so kind to answer everything," she added. She further called Shah Rukh a charming, intelligent and spontaneous human being.

397.title: Champion: Hardik Pandya on Karthik's 'dreams do come true' tweet
397.article_body: Replying to Dinesh Karthik's viral tweet, "Dreams do come true," all-rounder Hardik Pandya wrote, "Champion". Karthik had shared the tweet after being named in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad on Monday. The last time Karthik was included in India's T20 World Cup squad was for the 2010 edition. The 2022 T20 World Cup will be played in October-November.

398.title: Congress has surrendered, only AAP can compete with BJP: Minister
398.article_body: After eight Congress MLAs joined the BJP in Goa, Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema said that the Congress has surrendered before the BJP. "Only AAP can compete with [the BJP] as we have been able to make their Operation Lotus fail in Punjab," he added. He accused the BJP of trying to "purchase" AAP MLAs for ₹25 crore each.

399.title: PCMC Additional Municipal Commissioner Vikas Dhakane transferred
399.article_body: Maharashtra government has transferred Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation's (PCMC) Additional Municipal Commissioner Vikas Dhakane. However, the state government has not yet announced the posting of Dhakane to any other city or district. PCMC Deputy Municipal Commissioner Smita Zagade will replace him. Meanwhile, Assistant Municipal Commissioner Balasaheb Khandekar has also been transferred.

400.title: 2 loan recovery agents attacked in Hyderabad's Hussaini Alam
400.article_body: Two loan recovery agents of a bank were allegedly attacked in Hyderabad's Hussaini Alam when they went to the house of a defaulter on Tuesday. Bharat Kumar Ragula and Koppula Raju went to the house of credit card payment defaulter near Charminar bus stand. The defaulter allegedly pushed the agents after which they were attacked by 30-35 people with lathis.

401.title: Half of Delhi's population will face impacts of high temp: UN agency
401.article_body: A report by the World Meteorological Organisation (WMO) notes that high-temperature heatwaves occurring frequently in Delhi are putting half of the national capital's population in vulnerable positions. Delhi witnessed five heatwaves with temperatures reaching up to 49.2°C between March and May. "This heatwave led to devastating socioeconomic and public health impacts," the report added.
